author: wddgit
body:
#### PR description:

Fix compiler warnings in Core that appear when GCC 9 shadowing
warnings are turned on.

These are fixed in several ways:

Some names are changed to be more descriptive (this is my second try at
this, in the original PR I often disambiguated names by adding numerical
suffixes but there is none of that in this PR)

Sometimes I added curly braces in appropriate places to put code
in separate blocks where that made sense.

In a few places in the tests, I broke large functions into smaller independent
functions.

Sometimes after carefully looking at the code I realized things could be
completely deleted or refactored in some way.

A little cleanup is mixed up with this. If I saw something that looked bad
in the vicinity of the shadowing fixes.

#### PR validation:

This relies on existing tests. Nothing should change in the externally
visible behavior of the code.
title: Fix GCC 9 shadowing compiler warnings in Core (2nd try)
